turns.content:
When we write the scientific name of an organism we have to write it in:
Group of answer choices

italics

CAPITALS

bold

GreekShare Prompt
When writing the scientific name of an organism, it should be written in italics.

The Kingdom \_\_\_\_\_\_\_ includes organisms ranging from green algae to flowering plants.
Group of answer choices

Animalea

Fungi

Protista

PlantaeShare Prompt
The Kingdom "Plantae" includes organisms ranging from green algae to flowering plants.

Which of these plants is named for its shape?
Group of answer choices

poison oak

cattails

Gerber daisy

fever fewShare Prompt
Cattails are named for their shape. The cylindrical brown spikes on the plant resemble the tail of a cat, hence the name cattails.

Which term comes next: kingdom, phylum, class, \_\_\_\_\_....
Group of answer choices

order

genus

family

speciesShare Prompt
The term that comes next after kingdom, phylum, and class is "order". The taxonomic hierarchy goes as follows: kingdom, phylum, class, order, family, genus, species.

In the list of taxonomy classification, related family are grouped into which category?

Group of answer choices

species

class

order

phylumShare Prompt
Related families are grouped into the category of "order" in taxonomy classification. The taxonomic hierarchy goes as follows: kingdom, phylum, class, order, family, genus, species.

Guam disease has been attributed to the toxins found in which of the following groups?
Group of answer choices

ferns

pine trees

cycads

palm treesShare Prompt

Guam disease has been attributed to the toxins found in "cycads". Cycads are a group of plants that are known to produce toxins, including the neurotoxin BMAA (beta-methylamino-L-alanine), which has been linked to the development of Guam disease.

Carolus Linnaeus named the plants according to number, arrangement and length of:
Group of answer choices

sepals

petals

stamen

carpelsShare Prompt

Carolus Linnaeus named plants according to the number, arrangement, and length of "stamens and carpels". This system of classification is known as the sexual system, where plants were classified based on their reproductive organs.
you can only choose one answerShare Prompt
My apologies, thank you for the correction. In that case, Carolus Linnaeus named plants according to the number, arrangement, and length of "stamens".

Which of these semiprecious stones comes from conifers?
Group of answer choices

blue topaz

amber

turquoise

jadeShare Prompt

Amber is a semiprecious stone that comes from conifers. Amber is fossilized tree resin, which comes primarily from conifers and other trees. It is a popular semiprecious stone that has been used for jewelry and decorative purposes for thousands of years.
